definition[0]: if a horse gallops, it moves very fast with all its feet leaving the ground together
example[0]: A neighbourâ€™s horse came galloping down the road, riderless.
definition[1]: if you gallop, you ride very fast on a horse or you make it go very fast
example[2]: I watched as Jan galloped away.
example[3]: Ian came galloping down the stairs.
definition[3]: the movement of a horse at its fastest speed, when all four feet leave the ground together
example[4]: The horses broke into a gallop  (=begin to go very fast).
example[5]: Mounted police charged at full gallop.
definition[4]: a ride on a horse when it is galloping
example[6]: The project began at full gallop.
